SkyHook
Cinema

Redefining What's Possible

A New Angle on Film

We know how frustrating it can be to not have the right tool for the job. When we realized that filmmaker's creativity was being stifled by expensive and outdated equipment, we started thinking of ways to modify existing gear. We wanted to eliminate high costs and low mobility, but nothing was giving us the results we wanted. We realized an altogether different approach was needed. So we rolled up our sleeves and created a solution.

Platform Overview

The Skyhook is an eight-line robotic camera platform suspended from four anchor points.

Filmmakers can maneuver smoothly throughout the entirety of a three-dimensional space, capturing complex shots easily.

Gallery
Cinematic Freedom

The SkyHook Cinema takes filmmakers to new levels of freedom and simplicity. Combining the functionality of cranes, dollies, tracks, and sliders, it frees videographers to focus on getting the perfect shot. With its overhead suspension and programmable flight paths, the SkyHook platform makes choreographed scenes and hard-to-capture shots easier to execute than ever before.

Developer Friendly

We're making an interface that we're proud of, but we realize that it may not be perfect for every situation. In an effort to make our platform as user friendly as possible, we've decided to create an open access API, enabling developers to control the platform with a WiFi device of their choosing. We want to increase creativity, not constrain it.

Quick Specifications

target price: under $20k
operation area: 60'x60'x40'
cables: 8-cables, 4 anchor points
setup: 5-15 minutes with existing rigging
camera support: GoPro, DSLR, RED
max weight: 30 lbs (with camera)
control: remote wireless controller
battery life: approx. 60 minutes
